attributes.action: Reform Parliament to a collaborative rather than the current oppositional system
attributes.additional_details:
There are examples of assemblies such as the Scottish parliament that don't have an adversarial chamber and they have been shown to be effective
Adversarial politics/behaviour leads to protectionism, delays and avoiding difficult decisions
It is timely due to Brexit, and the greater similarity between parties.
There should not be pressure on a 'shadow' parliament to automatically oppose everything the PM says.
Instead every MP has a duty and responsibility to represent their constituents
attributes.background:
At present MPs sit in opposition as adversaries instead of working together
There would be less need for a 2 party system defaulting to oppose the government
MPs would be empowered to represent their constituents more & hold govt to account
Right decisions that might seem difficult could be made

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. 

We're not sure what you mean by a collaborative system. You could start a petition asking for the UK Government and Parliament to change the House of Commons Chamber to a semi-circular layout, like the Scottish Parliament.
